I expected 0-0 without c3, but now I'll diverge from the previously mentioned game

Not a novelty but a rare variation found only in Alaux-Nobili, France 1999, the idea is to get a7 for my knight or bishop (if needed, keeping an eye on f2 and indirectly white's king) while at the same time prevent b4, also allowing white's bishop to remain on b5 he might latter try to exchange it for my c6 knight...
